memberdef.name: MatrixType

memberdef.definition: std::shared_ptr< MultiArcDynamicsSimulator< StateScalarType, TimeType > > tudat::propagators::MultiArcVariationalEquationsSolver< StateScalarType, TimeType >::dynamicsSimulator_
memberdef.name: dynamicsSimulator_

briefdescription.para: Object to propagate the dynamics for all arcs.

memberdef.definition: std::vector< std::vector< std::map< double, Eigen::MatrixXd > > > tudat::propagators::MultiArcVariationalEquationsSolver< StateScalarType, TimeType >::variationalEquationsSolution_
memberdef.name: variationalEquationsSolution_

briefdescription.para: Numerical solution history of integrated variational equations, per arc.

detaileddescription.para: Numerical solution history of integrated variational equations, per arc. Each vector entry contains the results of a single arc, stored in a vector of maps. Inner vector has size two: first entry is state transition matrix history, second is sensitivity matrix history, both stored as maps. Key of map denotes time, values are matrices.

briefdescription.para: List of start times of each arc. NOTE: This list is updated after every propagation.
Settings for propagation of equations of motion.

memberdef.definition: std::vector< std::shared_ptr< DynamicsStateDerivativeModel< TimeType, StateScalarType > > > tudat::propagators::MultiArcVariationalEquationsSolver< StateScalarType, TimeType >::dynamicsStateDerivatives_
memberdef.name: dynamicsStateDerivatives_

briefdescription.para: State derivative models for each arc (retrieved from dynamicsSimulator_).
Number of arcs over which propagation is to be performed.
Boolean denoting whether to reset the multi-arc dynamics after propagation.

memberdef.argsstring: (const simulation_setup::SystemOfBodies &bodies, const std::shared_ptr< numerical_integrators::IntegratorSettings< TimeType > > integratorSettings, const std::shared_ptr< PropagatorSettings< StateScalarType > > propagatorSettings, const std::shared_ptr< estimatable_parameters::EstimatableParameterSet< StateScalarType > > parametersToEstimate, const std::vector< double > arcStartTimes, const bool integrateDynamicalAndVariationalEquationsConcurrently=true, const std::shared_ptr< numerical_integrators::IntegratorSettings< double > > variationalOnlyIntegratorSettings=std::shared_ptr< numerical_integrators::IntegratorSettings< double > >(), const bool clearNumericalSolution=true, const bool integrateEquationsOnCreation=false, const bool resetMultiArcDynamicsAfterPropagation=true)
memberdef.name: MultiArcVariationalEquationsSolver

briefdescription.para: Constructor.

detaileddescription.para:
Constructor, sets up object for automatic evaluation and numerical integration of variational equations and equations of motion.
bodies
Map of bodies (with names) of all bodies in integration.
integratorSettings
Settings for numerical integrator.
propagatorSettings
Settings for propagator.
parametersToEstimate
Object containing all parameters that are to be estimated and their current settings and values.
arcStartTimes
Start times for separate arcs
integrateDynamicalAndVariationalEquationsConcurrently
Boolean defining whether variational and dynamical equations are to be propagated concurrently (if true) or sequentially (of false)
variationalOnlyIntegratorSettings
Settings for numerical integrator when integrating only variational equations.
clearNumericalSolution
Boolean to determine whether to clear the raw numerical solution member variables (default true) after propagation and resetting of state transition interface.
integrateEquationsOnCreation
Boolean to denote whether equations should be integrated immediately at the end of this contructor (default false).
resetMultiArcDynamicsAfterPropagation
Boolean denoting whether to reset the multi-arc dynamics after propagation (default true).

briefdescription.para: Destructor.
Function to integrate equations of motion only.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to integrate equations of motion only (for all arcs). If dynamical solution is to be processed, the environment is also updated to the new solution.
initialStateEstimate
Initial state of the equations of motion that is to be used (in same order as in parametersToEstimate_), concatenated for all arcs.

briefdescription.para: Function to integrate equations of motion only.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to integrate equations of motion only (for all arcs). If dynamical solution is to be processed, the environment is also updated to the new solution.
initialStateEstimate
Initial state of the equations of motion that is to be used, as a list with separate entries for each arc.

briefdescription.para: Function to integrate variational equations and equations of motion.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to integrate variational equations and equations of motion, for all arcs. At the end of this function, the stateTransitionInterface_ is reset with the new state transition and sensitivity matrices. If dynamical solution is to be processed, the environment is also updated to the new solution.
concatenatedInitialStates
Initial state of the equations of motion that is to be used (in same order as in parametersToEstimate_), concatenated for all arcs.
integrateEquationsConcurrently
Variable determining whether the equations of motion are to be propagated concurrently with variational equations of motion (if true), or before variational equations (if false).

briefdescription.para: Function to integrate variational equations and equations of motion.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to integrate variational equations and equations of motion, for all arcs. At the end of this function, the stateTransitionInterface_ is reset with the new state transition and sensitivity matrices. If dynamical solution is to be processed, the environment is also updated to the new solution.
initialStateEstimate
Initial state of the equations of motion that is to be used, in a list with initial state for each arc stored separately.
integrateEquationsConcurrently
Variable determining whether the equations of motion are to be propagated concurrently with variational equations of motion (if true), or before variational equations (if false).

memberdef.definition: std::shared_ptr< MultiArcDynamicsSimulator< StateScalarType, TimeType > > tudat::propagators::MultiArcVariationalEquationsSolver< StateScalarType, TimeType >::getDynamicsSimulator
memberdef.name: getDynamicsSimulator

briefdescription.para: Function to return object used for numerically propagating and managing the solution of the equations of motion.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to return object used for numerically propagating and managing the solution of the equations of motion.
Object used for numerically propagating and managing the solution of the equations of motion.

memberdef.definition: std::shared_ptr< DynamicsSimulator< StateScalarType, TimeType > > tudat::propagators::MultiArcVariationalEquationsSolver< StateScalarType, TimeType >::getDynamicsSimulatorBase
memberdef.name: getDynamicsSimulatorBase

briefdescription.para: Function to retrieve the dynamics simulator object (as base-class pointer)

detaileddescription.para:
Function to retrieve the dynamics simulator object (as base-class pointer)
Dynamics simulator object (as base-class pointer)

memberdef.argsstring: (const Eigen::Matrix< StateScalarType, Eigen::Dynamic, 1 > newParameterEstimate, const bool areVariationalEquationsToBeIntegrated=true)
memberdef.name: resetParameterEstimate

briefdescription.para: Function to reset parameter estimate and re-integrate equations of motion and, if desired, variational equations.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to reset parameter estimate and re-integrate equations of motion and, if desired, variational equations using the new physical parameters/body initial states.
newParameterEstimate
New estimate of parameters that are to be estimated, in same order as defined in parametersToEstimate_ member.
areVariationalEquationsToBeIntegrated
Boolean defining whether the variational equations are to be reintegrated with the new parameter values.

memberdef.definition: std::vector< std::vector< std::map< double, Eigen::MatrixXd > > > tudat::propagators::MultiArcVariationalEquationsSolver< StateScalarType, TimeType >::getNumericalVariationalEquationsSolution
memberdef.name: getNumericalVariationalEquationsSolution

briefdescription.para: Function to return the numerical solution history of integrated variational equations, per arc.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to return the numerical solution history of integrated variational equations, per arc. Each vector entry contains the results of a single arc, stored in a vector of maps. Inner vector has size two: first entry is state transition matrix history, second is sensitivity matrix history, both stored as maps. Key of map denotes time, values are matrices.
Numerical solution history of integrated variational equations, per arc.

briefdescription.para: Function to return list of start times of each arc. NOTE: This list is updated after every propagation.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to return list of start times of each arc. NOTE: This list is updated after every propagation.
List of start times of each arc. NOTE: This list is updated after every propagation.

memberdef.definition: std::vector< std::shared_ptr< DynamicsStateDerivativeModel< TimeType, StateScalarType > > > tudat::propagators::MultiArcVariationalEquationsSolver< StateScalarType, TimeType >::getDynamicsStateDerivatives
memberdef.name: getDynamicsStateDerivatives

briefdescription.para: Reset solutions of variational equations.

detaileddescription.para: Reset solutions of variational equations (stateTransitionMatrixInterpolator_ and sensitivityMatrixInterpolator_) for each arc,* i.e. use numerical integration results to create new look-up tables and interpolators of state transition and sensitivity matrices.

memberdef.definition: std::vector< std::vector< std::pair< int, int > > > tudat::propagators::MultiArcVariationalEquationsSolver< StateScalarType, TimeType >::getArcWiseStatePartialAdditionIndices
memberdef.name: getArcWiseStatePartialAdditionIndices

briefdescription.para: Class to manage and execute the numerical integration of variational equations of a dynamical system in multiple arcs.

detaileddescription.para: Class to manage and execute the numerical integration of variational equations of a dynamical system, in addition to the dynamics itself, in multiple arcs: i.e. the governing equations are propagated for a set of predescribed intervals. In this class, the governing equations are set once, but can be re-integrated for different initial conditions using the same instance of the class.
